variants.name: Tubfalet (Tubfalet (Crippler))
variants.description: The venerable Palavret has been a mainstay of the Korath raiding fleet, elements of its design dating back from before the era of shortages and desperation caused by a life in exile. Over forty generations of raiders have terrorized neighboring systems over the centuries. 	Constant warfare against surrounding aliens has been building pressure on Korath shipyards to recover some of their ancient prowess. Now, with a fresh industrial network to draw upon, the Korath have created a new raider to deal with modern targets, and the Tubfalet-Class Raiding Ship is named for an admiral who dealt with such enemies. Despite extensive injuries, he remained on his flag bridge during a Remnant attack, leading his squadron to victory.

variants.name: 'nra'ret ('nra'ret (Crippler))
variants.description: While perhaps, at first, seeming like a super-sized 'olofez-Class Carried Chaser, the 'nra'ret-Class Chaser is not only the first truly unique warship design the Exiles have fielded since the Exodus, but also the first built solely for combat instead of needing to double as a habitat or supply ship. Its size and non-modular nature also means it must be constructed wholesale at the largest Korath facilities, something that, until recently, was generally reserved for the likes of the massive Ik'atilajej and the Korsmanath A'awoj. 	The 'nra'ret-Class Chaser, named in honor of a brilliant weapons engineer who took their own life to avoid having their secrets captured by a hostile alien force, provides the Exiles with a fast and powerful patrol striker both in support of large raiding fleets and as independent units. To this end, it is armed with numerous missile ports designed to rain fire on enemies from afar. It also carries a pair of langrage heavers for sustained operations, and two Fire-Lances for emergency use in close quarters.

variants.name: 'olofez ('olofez (World-Ship))
variants.description: The 'olofez-Class Carried Chaser, named for a renowned artist who painted their visions of ancient hunts, is a fighter carried by most Exile capital ships. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

variants.name: Lor'kas Ik 577 (Lor'kas Ik 577 (Digger))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. The simplest are adapted to haul materials between refinery and factory stations. Fittingly, they're named after a productive colony of the Efreti, to honor their focus on peaceful industry.

variants.name: Ra'gru Ik 618 (Ra'gru Ik 618 (Crippled))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This deceptively spindly ship bristles with weapon emplacements for heavy raiding or defending other vessels. It is named after the Mereti's capital planet, where they made powerful warships out of modular components.

variants.name: Ra'gru Ik 618 (Ra'gru Ik 618 (Ember))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This deceptively spindly ship bristles with weapon emplacements for heavy raiding or defending other vessels. variants.name: Kas'lor Ik 582 (Kas'lor Ik 582 (Stranded))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This relatively streamlined ship has been adapted to collect, refine, and transport hyperspace fuel. Its name refers to the delicious squids that lived in their gas giants, and especially Deka Dathnak.

variants.name: Kas'lor Ik 582 (Kas'lor Ik 582 (Ember))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This relatively streamlined ship has been adapted to collect, refine, and transport hyperspace fuel. Its name refers to the delicious squids that lived in their gas giants, and especially Deka Dathnak.

variants.name: Lor'nag Ik 590 (Lor'nag Ik 590 (Grab))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This bulbous ship has been adapted to carry passengers between stations, or boarding parties into enemy strongholds. Its name is in memory of the Anatruskor, who invented the jump drive.

variants.name: Lor'nag Ik 590 (Lor'nag Ik 590 (Troop Transport))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This bulbous ship has been adapted to carry passengers between stations, or boarding parties into enemy strongholds. Its name is in memory of the Anatruskor, who invented the jump drive.

variants.name: Ra'at Ik 621 (Ra'at Ik 621 (Digger))
variants.description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This many-lobed ship has been adapted to carry fighters into large-scale raids, or mining craft into asteroid belts. Its radial arrangements of hangars allows fighters a maximum variety of safe approach patterns in combat. Sestor exiles, who had a great affinity for carriers and fighters, bequeathed this variant its name after their capital world.

variants.name: Korsmanath A'awoj (Korsmanath A'awoj (Strike))
variants.description: Korsmanath A'awojs, named in memory of the Korath home system, are massive nomadic habitats that hold much of their remaining population. True flying cities, they could be self-contained miniature worlds were it not for their heavy defensive armament and reliance on unsustainable materials, methods, and sources of power. 	Commission of new Korsmanath A'awojs is a resource-demanding, labor-intensive, painstaking process fraught with political intrigue. Navarchs fight with the civilian government for resources and yard time they would rather devote to building raiding and defensive fleets, civilians vie with each other for a place on the next ship, and planning committees argue with engineers over what methods and technologies to use. This leads to construction delays, corner-cutting, and over-militarization of the design at best, and violent feuds at worst.

variants.name: Kar Ik Vot 349 (Kar Ik Vot 349 (Offense))
variants.description: The largest and deadliest of the Kor Sestor robotic warships, a single one of these battlecruisers can hold its own against an entire fleet of lesser ships.

variants.name: Kar Ik Vot 349 (Kar Ik Vot 349 (Defense))
variants.description: The largest and deadliest of the Kor Sestor robotic warships, a single one of these battlecruisers can hold its own against an entire fleet of lesser ships.

variants.name: Kar Ik Vot 349 (Kar Ik Vot 349 (Trapper))
variants.description: The largest and deadliest of the Kor Sestor robotic warships, a single one of these battlecruisers can hold its own against an entire fleet of lesser ships.

variants.name: Tek Far 71 - Lek (Tek Far 71 - Lek (Close Quarters))
variants.description: The Kor Sestor war fleets rely heavily on small, powerful fighters and drones. This ship can carry up to ten of their drones, clamped to the exterior of its hull.

variants.name: Tek Far 78 - Osk (Tek Far 78 - Osk (Close Quarters))
variants.description: This carrier is equipped with docking clamps for up to nine fighters. When loaded with a full complement of the powerful Kor Sestor robotic fighters, it is a formidable opponent.

variants.name: Met Par Tek 53 (Met Par Tek 53 (Sniper))
variants.description: Although this is the smallest Kor Sestor ship other than their fighters, it is larger than most human capital ships and considerably more powerful.

variants.name: Finch (Finch (MZ))
variants.description: When the Free Worlds started requesting a Carrier solution from its local shipyards, Tarazed Shipyards quickly saw that a few modifications could make their entry level interceptor into a top tier fighter. Over 85% of the parts that make up the Finch are shared with the Sparrow assembly line, so it's no surprise that even trimmed down to (barely) fit into a fighter bay, the blindingly fast Finch bears strong resemblance to its hyperspace-faring cousin. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

variants.name: Albatross (Albatross (Sniper))
variants.description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. Using new composite materials that they discovered, they built ships very different from anything seen in human space.

variants.description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. variants.name: Modified Dromedary (Modified Dromedary Ghost)
variants.description: The Tycho Crater Cooperative's Dromedary was one of the foremost colonization ships during the early era before piracy became rampant and triggered the necessity for city-ships to be more combat-oriented. These ships incorporate extensive hydroponics, large construction equipment installations, and hundreds of densely packed "dream cells" built to transport people in bulk. 	Since the Remnant do not have schematics for the Dromedary, just the highly-modified example of the Shattered Light, this ship is actually a commemorative replica of that specific ship. As such, it combines the original's odd mix of eclectic modifications with new Remnant systems. 	Unfortunately, since they lack the manufacturing facilities that would normally support a large construction project, it will cost massively more than it would have originally back on Luna.

variants.name: Modified Dromedary (Modified Dromedary Specter)
variants.description: The Tycho Crater Cooperative's Dromedary was one of the foremost colonization ships during the early era before piracy became rampant and triggered the necessity for city-ships to be more combat-oriented. As such, it combines the original's odd mix of eclectic modifications with new Remnant systems. 	Unfortunately, since they lack the manufacturing facilities that would normally support a large construction project, it will cost massively more than it would have originally back on Luna.

variants.name: Modified Dromedary (Modified Dromedary Wreck)
variants.description: The Tycho Crater Cooperative's Dromedary was one of the foremost colonization ships during the early era before piracy became rampant and triggered the necessity for city-ships to be more combat-oriented. These ships incorporate extensive hydroponics, large construction equipment installations, and hundreds of densely packed "dream cells" built to transport people in bulk. 	Since the Remnant do not have schematics for the Dromedary, just the highly-modified example of the Shattered Light, this ship is actually a commemorative replica of that specific ship. As such, it combines the original's odd mix of eclectic modifications with new Remnant systems. 	Unfortunately, since they lack the manufacturing facilities that would normally support a large construction project, it will cost massively more than it would have originally back on Luna.

variants.name: Merganser (Merganser (II))
variants.description: The Merganser is the first production ship the Remnant deem to be truly alive, and are considered to be equivalent to dolphins in reasoning tests. These interceptors, deemed for short range operations by Remnant standards, are designed to patrol the upper atmosphere of gas giants and use their decisive speed advantage to conduct hit-and-run attacks on threats in nearby systems. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Merganser's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

variants.name: Peregrine (Peregrine (II))
variants.description: The Peregrine is the first capital warship designed by Taely using fresh insights garnered from recent experimentation as well as renewed studies of the void sprites. Encompassing over a century of development since the last generation of warships was built, it is the forerunner of a new breed of Remnant ships. 	The Peregrine was designed along the lines of old-earth's fast-attack cruisers. Drawing on inspiration from its namesake, famed for being the fastest self-propelled lifeform on Earth, it is designed to strike hard and fast. It closes quickly with enemies to unleash devastating barrages in the opening seconds of combat. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Peregrine's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

variants.name: Starling (Starling (Sniper))
variants.description: One of the strangest and most useful things that the Remnant have discovered in the abandoned worlds of the Ember Waste is alien cloaking technology. They have designed their scout ships to cloak when needed in order to explore alien territory without being seen... or to escape in a hurry after stealing something particularly valuable from those aliens. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Starling's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

variants.name: Starling (Starling (Hunter))
variants.description: One of the strangest and most useful things that the Remnant have discovered in the abandoned worlds of the Ember Waste is alien cloaking technology. They have designed their scout ships to cloak when needed in order to explore alien territory without being seen... or to escape in a hurry after stealing something particularly valuable from those aliens. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Starling's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

variants.name: Starling (Starling (Thrasher))
variants.description: One of the strangest and most useful things that the Remnant have discovered in the abandoned worlds of the Ember Waste is alien cloaking technology. They have designed their scout ships to cloak when needed in order to explore alien territory without being seen... or to escape in a hurry after stealing something particularly valuable from those aliens. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Starling's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

variants.name: Emerald Sword (Emerald Sword (Fixed))
variants.description: An ancient Sheragi warship that was crewed by mutineers that fled from their civil war and escaped into interstellar space. Found orbiting a disconnected star, this is an impressively large ship, fit for the equally large Sheragi. The ship's main weapon is a fusion-pumped gamma-ray laser called the 'Dragonflame Cannon.' Despite the relatively primitive outfits, it's still a very capable war machine due to its size. For its original Sheragi masters, this warship was home to around 100 individuals. For others, however, that number more than doubles, bringing it on par with the largest city ships.

variants.name: Aaulqra (Aaulqra (Brawler))
variants.description: The Aaulqra is the oldest warship design currently produced by the High Houses in Successor space, with a recognizable lineage continuing back several thousand years to early in the old empire. It is compact, fast, and durable for a ship of its class, but has relatively limited internal space and lacks any significant cargo or passenger facilities. The captains of these vessels are often up-and-coming Successor officers hoping to prove themselves to one of the High Houses by demonstrating their mastery of the vessel; while most, of course, do not, the ship's flexibility and ubiquitous presence make it an excellent starting point for those who do.

variants.name: Aaulqra (Aaulqra (Sniper))
variants.description: The Aaulqra is the oldest warship design currently produced by the High Houses in Successor space, with a recognizable lineage continuing back several thousand years to early in the old empire. It is compact, fast, and durable for a ship of its class, but has relatively limited internal space and lacks any significant cargo or passenger facilities. The captains of these vessels are often up-and-coming Successor officers hoping to prove themselves to one of the High Houses by demonstrating their mastery of the vessel; while most, of course, do not, the ship's flexibility and ubiquitous presence make it an excellent starting point for those who do.

variants.name: Kaskhorade (Kaskhorade (Brawler))
variants.description: Serving as the heavy multipurpose backbone of the fleets of the various High Houses, the Kaskhorade trades some of the maneuverability of its smaller siblings for greater flexibility; in addition to being a capable warship, it also offers a sizable amount of free cargo and bunk space that allow it to fulfill a wide variety of missions. Along with serving as convoy escorts and fleet warships, these vessels are often used to transport high-ranking members of the High Houses, as they can remain well-defended while outfitted for fast and luxurious travel.

variants.name: Kaskhorade (Kaskhorade (Sniper))
variants.description: Serving as the heavy multipurpose backbone of the fleets of the various High Houses, the Kaskhorade trades some of the maneuverability of its smaller siblings for greater flexibility; in addition to being a capable warship, it also offers a sizable amount of free cargo and bunk space that allow it to fulfill a wide variety of missions. Along with serving as convoy escorts and fleet warships, these vessels are often used to transport high-ranking members of the High Houses, as they can remain well-defended while outfitted for fast and luxurious travel.

variants.name: Kvelqde (Kvelqde (Mining))
variants.description: This tiny shuttle is the smallest vessel operating in Successor space, and the first ship that new Successor pilots are able to get their arms on. Despite their small size, they are capable multipurpose vessels, and are frequently used for transporting passengers and cargo, and for short-duration research expeditions. 	The design of the Kvelqde is, like most Successor vessels, based on originals from the time of the Predecessors. While the modern incarnation is nowhere near as advanced, successive iterations with more limited resources have promoted the cost-efficiency and user-friendliness of the design.

variants.name: Kvelqde (Kvelqde (Violent))
variants.description: This tiny shuttle is the smallest vessel operating in Successor space, and the first ship that new Successor pilots are able to get their arms on. Despite their small size, they are capable multipurpose vessels, and are frequently used for transporting passengers and cargo, and for short-duration research expeditions. 	The design of the Kvelqde is, like most Successor vessels, based on originals from the time of the Predecessors. While the modern incarnation is nowhere near as advanced, successive iterations with more limited resources have promoted the cost-efficiency and user-friendliness of the design.

variants.name: Kvelqde-Khora (Kvelqde-Khora (Mining))
variants.description: One of the more industrious members of the People's Houses has done their best to ruggedize this Kvelqde: additional armor plating has been laid over most of the exposed hull, a second gun port has been attached to the underside, and the shield grid has had its capacity substantially increased. While not quite capable of standing toe-to-toe with a production interceptor of the High Houses, it bares enough teeth for a bit of light piracy, and its greater durability is quite welcome for navigating the decaying stations and hostile worlds of southwestern Successor space.

variants.name: Myaede (Myaede (Mining))
variants.description: The Myaede is neither elegant nor fast, but it has remained the mainstay of Successor commerce since before the collapse of the old empire over a thousand years ago, boasting a spacious cargo hold, heavy armor, and a flexible enough weapons layout to let it fight back in a pinch. Much like the grand heirlooms of the High Houses, a familial Myaede is often passed down through the lineage of spacefaring low-born Successors, and many of the pilots flying these first took the helm as children under a grandparent's watchful gaze.

variants.name: Myaede (Myaede (Mining, Defensive))
variants.description: The Myaede is neither elegant nor fast, but it has remained the mainstay of Successor commerce since before the collapse of the old empire over a thousand years ago, boasting a spacious cargo hold, heavy armor, and a flexible enough weapons layout to let it fight back in a pinch. Much like the grand heirlooms of the High Houses, a familial Myaede is often passed down through the lineage of spacefaring low-born Successors, and many of the pilots flying these first took the helm as children under a grandparent's watchful gaze.

variants.name: Myaede (Myaede (Violent))
variants.description: The Myaede is neither elegant nor fast, but it has remained the mainstay of Successor commerce since before the collapse of the old empire over a thousand years ago, boasting a spacious cargo hold, heavy armor, and a flexible enough weapons layout to let it fight back in a pinch. Much like the grand heirlooms of the High Houses, a familial Myaede is often passed down through the lineage of spacefaring low-born Successors, and many of the pilots flying these first took the helm as children under a grandparent's watchful gaze.

variants.name: Nnaatej (Nnaatej (Defensive))
variants.description: Owing to their amphibious nature, a substantial portion of the Successor population lives underwater. Most of their ships are built with this in mind and are capable of some degree of underwater operation. However, the Nnaatej is a specialist vessel built specifically for this purpose, shuttling passengers from deep ocean to deep space and back again. It is designed with a denser, pressure-stable hull, built-in maintenance systems, and increased resistance to corrosion and slowing effects. These features come at the cost of making it a heavy and expensive ship for its size, but are considered well worth it to ensure the safety and comfort of its passengers and cargo.

variants.name: Ojde (Ojde (Mining))
variants.description: Although it is the largest freighter employed by the Successors, the "Ojde" is still substantially smaller than large human freighters like the Bulk Freighter and Behemoth. While this limits the cargo capacity of any single ship, it also allows these vessels to be surprisingly fast and maneuverable and increases the number of facilities which can effectively tend to them. 	Though somewhat less popular among more traditional merchants than the time-tested Myaede, the increased cargo capacity of the Ojde makes it a more or less mandatory choice for those hoping to assemble a large-scale transport operation.

variants.name: Stolsaqra (Stolsaqra (Military))
variants.description: The Successors have limited experience in making warships this small, and while their attempt at an interceptor is durable and sports a surprising amount of firepower for a ship of its size, it is also plagued with power and propulsion issues, as most of their standard technology is either too large or not powerful enough to yield effective combat performance at this scale. The result is a ship that ambitious pilots call a challenge and prudent captains call a deathtrap, but that continues to see use as a patrol and escort vessel because of its speed and heavy armament. 	The Stolsaqra also has the distinction of being the only purpose-built warship manufactured by the High Houses that is made available to the general public, albeit with significantly downgraded systems compared to the military-exclusive model.

variants.name: Stolsaqra (Stolsaqra (Mission Escort))
variants.description: The Successors have limited experience in making warships this small, and while their attempt at an interceptor is durable and sports a surprising amount of firepower for a ship of its size, it is also plagued with power and propulsion issues, as most of their standard technology is either too large or not powerful enough to yield effective combat performance at this scale. The result is a ship that ambitious pilots call a challenge and prudent captains call a deathtrap, but that continues to see use as a patrol and escort vessel because of its speed and heavy armament. 	The Stolsaqra also has the distinction of being the only purpose-built warship manufactured by the High Houses that is made available to the general public, albeit with significantly downgraded systems compared to the military-exclusive model.

variants.name: Stolsaqra (Stolsaqra (Short-Range))
variants.description: The Successors have limited experience in making warships this small, and while their attempt at an interceptor is durable and sports a surprising amount of firepower for a ship of its size, it is also plagued with power and propulsion issues, as most of their standard technology is either too large or not powerful enough to yield effective combat performance at this scale. The result is a ship that ambitious pilots call a challenge and prudent captains call a deathtrap, but that continues to see use as a patrol and escort vessel because of its speed and heavy armament. 	The Stolsaqra also has the distinction of being the only purpose-built warship manufactured by the High Houses that is made available to the general public, albeit with significantly downgraded systems compared to the military-exclusive model.

variants.name: Veusade (Veusade (Surveillance))
variants.description: Blessed with the honor of being named with the Successor word for swiftness, the Veusade is designed for only one purpose: to carry eight drag cannons as close to an enemy ship's hull as possible. 	Vessels of this lineage earned renown in many of the conflicts between the Predecessors' High Houses, catching and killing ships many times their size and escaping before reinforcements could arrive. In the present, such a narrowly-focused design makes these vessels ill-suited for multipurpose use, but they are frequently seen as auxiliary or police craft, owing to their ability to rapidly intercept and immobilize fleeing ships.

variants.name: Vujlet (Vujlet (Aggressive))
variants.description: Navigating the stars with the grace of a flitting bird, the compact Vujlet is a mass-produced High Houses warship flexible enough to serve in a variety of light-duty roles. Large enough to operate as a self-sufficient unit, these vessels serve as a useful bridge between short-ranged and relatively vulnerable interceptors, and larger, more resource-intensive warships that can be much more expensive to build and operate. 	The design was originally employed by House Kaatrij as a stealth reconnaissance vessel that made use of their then-recently-developed cloaking technology. As the alliance between the New Houses strengthened, the plans for the Vujlet were distributed among them, and the light warship rapidly became a mainstay of their fleets. Unfortunately, without the materials present in their Predecessors' domain, House Kaatrij has been unable to manufacture stealth equipment for the Vujlet in the modern era.

variants.name: Vujlet (Vujlet (Surveillance))
variants.description: Navigating the stars with the grace of a flitting bird, the compact Vujlet is a mass-produced High Houses warship flexible enough to serve in a variety of light-duty roles. Large enough to operate as a self-sufficient unit, these vessels serve as a useful bridge between short-ranged and relatively vulnerable interceptors, and larger, more resource-intensive warships that can be much more expensive to build and operate. 	The design was originally employed by House Kaatrij as a stealth reconnaissance vessel that made use of their then-recently-developed cloaking technology. As the alliance between the New Houses strengthened, the plans for the Vujlet were distributed among them, and the light warship rapidly became a mainstay of their fleets. Unfortunately, without the materials present in their Predecessors' domain, House Kaatrij has been unable to manufacture stealth equipment for the Vujlet in the modern era.

variants.name: Vyrmeid (Vyrmeid (B))
variants.description: These are tiny space creatures that feed on solar energy, storing it into two receptors found at the front of their bodies. They are extremely docile, and are found in large groups, almost never seen alone.

variants.name: Vyrmeid (Vyrmeid (C))
variants.description: These are tiny space creatures that feed on solar energy, storing it into two receptors found at the front of their bodies. They are extremely docile, and are found in large groups, almost never seen alone.

variants.name: Tempest (Tempest (Heavy))
variants.description: In response to the Unfettered invasion, the Wanderers have begun digging up ancient warship designs from their archives and putting them back into production. The Tempest is the first purpose-built warship they have manufactured in tens of thousands of years.

variants.name: Tempest (Tempest (Missile))
variants.description: In response to the Unfettered invasion, the Wanderers have begun digging up ancient warship designs from their archives and putting them back into production. The Tempest is the first purpose-built warship they have manufactured in tens of thousands of years.

variants.name: Tempest (Tempest (Moonbeam))
variants.description: In response to the Unfettered invasion, the Wanderers have begun digging up ancient warship designs from their archives and putting them back into production. The Tempest is the first purpose-built warship they have manufactured in tens of thousands of years.

variants.name: Derecho (Derecho (Tough))
variants.description: Like a latent gene waiting to express itself, the knowledge of how to wage war in space has been passed down through hundreds of generations of Wanderers. Based on one of their ancient designs, the Derecho has a mixture of agility and raw firepower that is well-suited to their present, rapidly changing situation.

variants.name: Derecho (Derecho (Moonbeam))
variants.description: Like a latent gene waiting to express itself, the knowledge of how to wage war in space has been passed down through hundreds of generations of Wanderers. Based on one of their ancient designs, the Derecho has a mixture of agility and raw firepower that is well-suited to their present, rapidly changing situation.

variants.name: Hurricane (Hurricane (Tough))
variants.description: The Hurricane is not built for speed, elegance, or versatility, but for one simple purpose: to be durable enough to serve as a rearguard, absorbing an enemy's attacks for long enough to allow the fleet it is guarding to escape.

variants.name: Hurricane (Hurricane (Moonbeam))
variants.description: The Hurricane is not built for speed, elegance, or versatility, but for one simple purpose: to be durable enough to serve as a rearguard, absorbing an enemy's attacks for long enough to allow the fleet it is guarding to escape.

variants.name: Winter Gale (Winter Gale (Heavy))
variants.description: The Winter Gale was designed by the Wanderers as a hardier and better-armed alternative to their existing light patrol ships. The Gale's large number of weapon hardpoints makes it flexible enough to reconfigure for facing a wide variety of enemies.

variants.name: Winter Gale (Winter Gale (Missile))
variants.description: The Winter Gale was designed by the Wanderers as a hardier and better-armed alternative to their existing light patrol ships. The Gale's large number of weapon hardpoints makes it flexible enough to reconfigure for facing a wide variety of enemies.

variants.name: Deep River (Deep River 0)
variants.description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

variants.name: Deep River (Deep River 1)
variants.description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

variants.name: Deep River (Deep River 2)
variants.description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

variants.name: Deep River (Deep River 3)
variants.description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

variants.name: Deep River (Deep River 4)
variants.description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

variants.name: Carrier (Carrier (Alpha))
variants.description: The Carrier is more than just a warship: it is practically a mobile space station, with docking bays for an entire squadron of drones and fighters and enough crew to fill a small village. Although designed primarily for engaging enemies from a distance, a Carrier can also do significant damage in close combat.

outfits.name: Korath Tek'far Reactor
outfits.description: This is a miniature nuclear reactor, used by the Korath to power their fighters.

outfits.name: Korath Tek'nel Reactor
outfits.description: This massive reactor was designed by the Korath to meet the power needs of their largest ships.

outfits.name: Korath Shield Generator
outfits.description: Korath fighters are not able to recharge their shields, but their larger ships are equipped with one of these.

outfits.name: Korath Heat Shunt
outfits.description: Korath weapons generate extreme amounts of heat, and the cooling systems they require are massive.

outfits.name: Korath Ark'torbal Thruster
outfits.description: This engine is used by Korath fighters.

outfits.name: Korath Ark'parat Steering
outfits.description: This engine is used by Korath fighters.

outfits.name: Korath Jak'torbal Thruster
outfits.description: This engine is used in the Korath capital ships.

outfits.name: Korath Jak'parat Steering
outfits.description: This engine is used in the Korath capital ships.

outfits.name: Mass Expansion
outfits.description: A mass expansion allows you to sacrifice some cargo space in order to make room for more outfits, in situations where you need just a bit more space to install a particular system. It does not increase your weapon or engine space unfortunately.

outfits.name: Cruiser License
outfits.description: It is a very rare privilege to be permitted to purchase a Navy capital ship for private use - not just because of a Cruiser's firepower, but because it is a potent symbol of the Republic's strength.

outfits.name: Carrier License
outfits.description: Only a handful of people in the past century have been given permission to purchase a Navy Carrier, even a decommissioned one, for private use.

outfits.name: Afterburner
outfits.description: An afterburner works by dumping hyperspace fuel into your engines and igniting it, producing a large amount of thrust. This can be very useful for dodging missiles or briefly escaping from faster opponents, but you must be careful to avoid using up so much fuel that you do not have enough left for hyperspace travel.

outfits.name: Korath Grab-Strike
outfits.description: Korath Grab-Strike projectiles are designed to pull a target closer to the Korath ship, to keep it from escaping.

outfits.name: Korath Banisher
outfits.description: The Korath like to keep their enemies close... but not too close.

outfits.name: Korath Warder
outfits.description: This anti-missile system helps defend Korath warships from long-range attacks.

outfits.name: Korath Fire-Lance
outfits.description: The Korath Fire-Lance is a medium-range beam weapon designed to be used by their fighters.

outfits.name: Korath Repeater
outfits.description: This is the smallest and simplest Korath projectile weapon, designed mostly for use on fighters and drones. As with most Korath technology, it generates a large amount of heat, enough that the gun must pause briefly after every few shots to cool down.

outfits.name: Korath Repeater Turret
outfits.description: Korath repeaters fire compact bolts of superheated plasma at their targets. For every one of these turrets installed on a ship, an auxiliary cooling system is typically required to cope with its heat output.

outfits.name: Korath Piercer
outfits.description: This missile is fired from a Korath Piercer Launcher.

outfits.name: Korath Piercer Rack
outfits.description: The Korath Piercer Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Korath Piercer Launchers.

outfits.name: Korath Piercer Launcher
outfits.description: Korath Piercer Missiles carry a pair of warheads. The first, a smaller one in the very tip of the missile, explodes on impact to blast a hole in the ship's shields to allow some of the subsequent, larger explosion to pierce through.

outfits.name: Korath Mine
outfits.description: This is ammunition for a Korath Minelayer. Each mine splits into eleven submunitions after it is deployed.

outfits.name: Korath Mine Rack
outfits.description: The Korath Mine Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Korath Minelayers.

outfits.name: Korath Minelayer
outfits.description: This launcher fires cluster munitions that split into a cloud of stationary mines that each do a considerable amount of damage if a ship crashes into them. However, if a ship hits the mine before it has a chance to deploy, the damage is considerably reduced.

outfits.name: Korath Disruptor
outfits.description: Korath Disruptors interfere with a ship's shields, allowing a ship's hull to be damaged even when shields are up. However, they do very little hull damage by themselves.

outfits.name: Korath Slicer
outfits.description: This massive beam weapon is relatively ineffective against shields, but cuts through hull armor like it's made of paper.

outfits.name: Korath Slicer Turret
outfits.description: This turret fires a tightly focused energy beam that is particularly effective against hull armor. When paired with a disruptor turret, it is a deadly combination.

outfits.name: Korath Repeater Rifle
outfits.description: This rifle is commonplace among the Korath, predating the creation of the Repeater by at least two centuries. As it uses superheated plasma instead of lasers, the rifle is slow to fire and can sometimes burn its user's hands if they aren't careful. It makes up for these setbacks by guaranteeing that those hit won't live long enough to fire back.

outfits.name: Nanotech Battery
outfits.description: Human engineers who first came into contact with the Quarg were astonished by the sheer efficiency of their technology. The energy density of Quarg batteries is unparalleled, storing nearly a third more energy than the best human batteries while being over a third smaller.

outfits.name: Quantum Shield Generator
outfits.description: The first humans who met the Quarg thought that their technology worked on magic, and many even think so to this day. The mechanism by which this Quarg shield generator works is completely unknown to humanity, and the Quarg aren't interested in giving up their secrets.

outfits.name: Intrusion Countermeasures
outfits.description: Quarg ships are outfitted with special systems for repelling boarders. Because no one wants to be caught by the Quarg with stolen technology, these systems are pretty much worthless on the open market.

outfits.name: Quarg Skylance
outfits.description: These immensely powerful beam weapons are used by Quarg warships to strike fear into the hearts of all who dare oppose them.

outfits.name: Quarg Anti-Missile
outfits.description: Quarg anti-missile defenses can target projectiles from considerable range compared to human technology, ensuring that only the most powerful missiles are capable of even getting near a Quarg ship.

outfits.name: Multimodal Armor: Resilient
outfits.description: This configuration is designed for exploring hazardous areas, substantially increasing the armor's ability to resist engine-dampening effects and long-term degradation.

outfits.name: Nettle Magazine
outfits.description: To improve the combat endurance of ships that rely on flooding the battlespace with small missiles, this magazine extends the capacity of Nettle launch cells by loading new Nettle KKVs through the bottoms of the cells.

outfits.name: Orchid Magazine
outfits.description: This large ammunition storage loads new Orchid Missiles into the launch tubes with little more than a few cables, actuators, and solenoids. Designed to be as minimalistic as possible, the sheer size of each Orchid nonetheless makes this magazine rather bulky for the number of missiles it stores.

outfits.name: Radiative Lamina
outfits.description: Laminae take advantage of special external hardpoints built into most Avgi ships, allowing them to be mounted without taking up any outfit space. However, they also tend to increase the amount of heat absorbed from the local star.

outfits.name: Concealment Lamina
outfits.description: Laminae take advantage of special external hardpoints built into most Avgi ships, allowing them to be mounted without taking up any outfit space. However, they also tend to increase the amount of heat absorbed from the local star.

outfits.name: Magnetic Scoop
outfits.description: A powerful bank of lasers ionizes the interstellar medium around ships equipped with these ramscoops, allowing a Magnetic Scoop to collect extra material on top of the naturally charged solar wind. This results in a more predictable supply of fuel, even around stars with solar winds poor in deuterium. Of course, the power the lasers require can be quite considerable, as is the heat produced from compressing the incident plasma.

outfits.name: Plasmadyne Scoop
outfits.description: This magnetic field spans a range far larger than what can be generated by any physical loop of wire of reasonable size, while also sparing a starship from carrying an enormous mass of superconducting wire. It does require a rather large amount of power to function, however, and the interaction with the plasma of the interplanetary medium causes a significant amount of drag.

outfits.name: Deuterium Slush Tank
outfits.description: This lightweight tank stores an appreciable amount of hyperspace fuel as deuterium slush - a slurry of liquid deuterium and deuterium ice. This allows fuel to be stored at higher densities than would otherwise be possible, but the cryocooler required to maintain the zero-boiloff system requires a small amount of energy to pump heat out of the pressure vessel.

outfits.name: Cryogenic Deuterium Tank
outfits.description: This insulated pressure vessel is designed to store hyperspace fuel under cryogenic temperatures for bulk transport. While not quite as efficient as a deuterium slush tank, this outfit is designed to fit into a ship's cargo space with minimal intrusion into space reserved for other systems, allowing many to be installed simultaneously without the need for deep cryocoolers.

outfits.name: Heatsink Partition
outfits.description: This lightweight modification partitions off a section of a ship's fuel tanks with an insulating membrane. This section can then be filled with a lithium hydride nanofluid with a high specific heat capacity, which coolant lines can be routed around. As a heatsink, it does not assist with cooling a ship, but allows it to temporarily take greater thermal loads while remaining at a safe temperature.

outfits.name: Multispectral Scanner
outfits.description: To increase the sensitivity of the instruments, certain components are cryocooled to temperatures ranging in the low microkelvins. The heat pump system responsible for maintaining this requires a surprising amount of power, while also producing a significant amount of waste heat.

outfits.name: Spectrometer Array
outfits.description: Unfortunately, while these sensors excel in reading basic physical and chemical information, such as the elemental composition of an object, the amount of sensor data required to predict an outfit's functionality means this sensor can be quite slow when scanning a ship's complex systems or cargo.

outfits.name: Diffuse Deflector
outfits.description: Unfortunately, for its size, you would expect this shield generator to be far more powerful than it actually is. While it is nearly as large as the heaviest human shield generators, it is only about half as strong, while also consuming far more power. Much of this power ends up being shed as waste heat instead of being used to efficiently regenerate a shield, resulting in a generator that can be generously described as anemic.

outfits.name: Specular Deflector
outfits.description: The limited success of the Avgi shield replication attempts are mitigated somewhat by the fact that the enormous superconducting coils in their shield generators store a similarly enormous amount of energy, making them effectively superconducting magnetic energy storage devices that slowly regenerate shields as a bonus.

outfits.name: Concentrating Solar Cell
outfits.description: This tiny solar generator efficiently collects sunlight, turning it into usable energy. Thin mirrors concentrate sunlight onto a small number of highly efficient film solar cells, reducing weight and improving overall efficiency. As the solar cells need to be cooled, a significant amount of waste heat is also produced.

outfits.name: Concentrating Solar Array
outfits.description: While much more efficient than a single cell alone, the Concentrating Solar Array also produces a disproportionate amount of heat.

outfits.name: Photoelectric Lamina
outfits.description: Photovoltaic Laminae take advantage of special external hardpoints built into most Avgi ships, allowing them to be mounted without taking up any outfit space. However, they also tend to increase the amount of heat absorbed from the local star.

outfits.name: Lantern Fission Core
outfits.description: Run at the very edge of its thermal limits, the Lantern does not tolerate overheating of its coolant loop, which can cause catastrophic damage if sustained.

outfits.name: Ultracapacitor Cell
outfits.description: Unfortunately, the internal structure of the capacitor is quite delicate, and is prone to potential discharge when exposed to external currents and ionization. Thankfully, resilient grounding and safety interlocks can prevent this discharge from becoming catastrophic.

outfits.name: Ultracapacitor Bank
outfits.description: "	Like its component cells, the capacitor bank is vulnerable to ionizing weapons, but is relatively better shielded for its size by virtue of its reduced surface area to volume ratio."

outfits.name: Magnetoplasma Drive
outfits.description: Designed to be clustered and oriented in any direction, the thruster layout gives a ship full six-axis control, allowing it to translate and rotate in any direction with ease.

outfits.name: Vapor Nuclear Rocket
outfits.description: The Vapor Gas Core Nuclear Thermal Rocket is derived from the same reactor design as the Lantern Fission Core, stripped of power conversion equipment and radiation shielding. Like the Lantern, an electrostatic field of a few volts is used to trap ionized uranium plasma in the reactor even as hot hydrogen flows freely. The engine is bimodal, producing a small trickle of power from thermionic converters, but this capability comes at the cost of constant heat generation.

outfits.name: Remass Injector
outfits.description: The Remass Injector is a component that can be installed into an Avgi fusion torch to give it afterburning capabilities. It requires a magnetic nozzle slot to be installed.

outfits.name: Inductive Extractor
outfits.description: The Inductive Extractor is a component that can be installed into an Avgi fusion torch to turn a portion of its thrust into energy. It requires a magnetic nozzle slot to be installed.

outfits.name: R-180 RCS Thrusters
outfits.description: Avgi reaction control thrusters are hybrid thermal-electric thrusters, designed to allow translation in any direction. By using reactor heat to expel superheated water vapor out of a set of nozzles, they can help a ship cool off, but require the ship to have excess heat in order to function.

outfits.name: R-360 RCS Thrusters
outfits.description: The Avgi have designed their reaction control thrusters to synergize with their fusion torches, tapping off high temperature waste heat and using it to superheat water for use in their reaction control systems. An additional magnetohydrodynamic accelerator around each thruster's nozzle improves specific impulse at the cost of significant energy use. These thrusters allow Avgi starships to easily dock with stations or other ships without igniting their highly radioactive fusion torches.

outfits.name: R-720 RCS Thrusters
outfits.description: This large set of 'teakettle' style reaction control thrusters can allow even the largest of Avgi starships to maneuver with ease, or even reverse course without needing to fully turn around. They also can be used to reject considerable amounts of waste heat by expelling superheated water vapor, boosted by an electromagnetic accelerator.

outfits.name: Optical Laser Rifle
outfits.description: Both the aiming scope and laser aperture share the same focusing mirror, eliminating scope parallax and allowing auto-focusing optics to easily aim the beam at anything the user can see in the scope.

outfits.name: Trefoil Board
outfits.description: You suppose the dense wood would make an adequate blunt weapon in a pinch, though it would be a shame to damage such a fine piece in something so crass as melee combat.

outfits.name: Damselflyman
outfits.description: This mysterious radioactive tumor, while benign, has grown unnaturally in the center of your chest, creating a glowing dragonfly-shaped patch in the middle of your sternum. Enemies panic and flee at the sight of it, but only when possession of a disabled starship is contested. Also, you really shouldn't be able to see this 'outfit.'

outfits.name: Lancet Adamant
outfits.description: A purely ceremonial weapon, this sleek shortspear is made from a continuous piece of adamantine, or nanodiamond. While not particularly useful in the realities of modern ranged combat, it certainly looks impressive.

outfits.name: Speck Round
outfits.description: These densely-wound metallic glass slugs are capable of inflicting a good amount of kinetic damage via hypervelocity impacts, but are easily stopped by momentum-repulsion shield systems.

outfits.name: Speck Magazine
outfits.description: While Speckle Coilguns carry a considerable amount of ammunition in their internal magazines, for longer expeditions or for resupply operations the Avgi use these compact ammunition storages.

outfits.name: Speckle Coilgun
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Speckle Turret
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Optical Lasing Generator
outfits.description: The wavelength of light produced in the coil can altered by swapping the diodes and fiber dopants, allowing the Optical Lasing Generator to support up to three Green Optical Lasers or a single Blue Optical Laser.

outfits.name: Green Optical Laser
outfits.description: The turret itself only contains the optics needed to synthesize, focus, and target the beam, allowing the laser light to be produced elsewhere. Because of this, an Optical Lasing Generator is needed to run this turret, providing enough power to support three Green Lasers.

outfits.name: Blue Optical Laser
outfits.description: The turret itself only contains the optics needed to synthesize, focus, and target the beam, allowing the laser light to be produced elsewhere. Because of this, an Optical Lasing Generator is needed to run this turret, providing enough power to support a single Blue Laser.

outfits.name: External Launch Rail
outfits.description: This pylon externally mounts a single torpedo, employing a small electromagnetic catapult to fling its payload towards a nearby target.

outfits.name: External Launch Tube
outfits.description: This is a large launcher capable of carrying and deploying large torch-driven missiles and torpedoes. With a standardized design, it is compatible with a wide range of Avgi torch missiles. A coilgun-based ejection system allows missiles to be deployed with considerable initial velocity.

outfits.name: Tiny VLS
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Small VLS
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Medium VLS
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Ophrys Stockpile
outfits.description: The restocking system requires oversight by a small team of specialists to ensure no accidents occur during the loading process.

outfits.name: Pinecone Launcher
outfits.description: When there is no one left to speak for the trees, these cannons will do all the talking.

outfits.name: Pollen
outfits.description: Achoo!

outfits.name: Jamfruit
outfits.description: Closer to a berry than a fruit, this tart prize of a Windjammer tree is not only delicious, but is rich in nutrients. It can be refined to extract a variety of useful medicinal compounds, giving it value both as a delicacy and as a remedy.

outfits.name: Shield Relay Booster
outfits.description: The Shield Relay Booster is a component that can be installed into a Bunrodean shield relay in order to modify its effectiveness. Boosters increase the shield generation strength of a relay, but at the cost of reduced energy efficiency.

outfits.name: Shield Relay Limiter
outfits.description: The Shield Relay Limiter is a component that can be installed into a Bunrodean shield relay in order to modify its effectiveness. Limiters increase the energy efficiency of a relay, but at the cost of reducing the strength of its shield generation.

outfits.name: Nanite Enhancer
outfits.description: The Nanite Enhancer is a component that can be installed into a Bunrodean nanite fabricator in order to modify its effectiveness. Enhancers increase the strength of the hull repair of a fabricator, but at the cost of reduced energy efficiency.

outfits.name: Nanite Limiter
outfits.description: The Nanite Limiter is a component that can be installed into a Bunrodean nanite fabricator in order to modify its effectiveness. Limiters increase the energy and heat efficiency of a fabricator, but at the cost of reducing the strength of its hull repair.

outfits.name: Solar Cell
outfits.description: These cells must be installed on the mounting platform that comes with a solar battery to be used.

outfits.name: Reactor Overclocker
outfits.description: The Reactor Overclocker is a component that can be installed into a Bunrodea reactor in order to modify its effectiveness. Overclockers increase the strength of the energy generation of a reactor, but at the cost of reduced heat efficiency.

outfits.name: Reactor Limiter
outfits.description: The Reactor Limiter is a component that can be installed into a Bunrodea reactor in order to modify its effectiveness. Limiters increase the heat efficiency of a reactor, but at the cost of reducing the strength of its energy generation.

outfits.name: Lasher Pistol
outfits.description: During their wars with the Korath, it was not uncommon for Bunrodean vessels to be boarded by Korath raiders looking for technology and supplies to steal. As such, effective small arms weapons became an essential part of every Bunrodean crew that may need to fight off any boarding parties.

outfits.name: Chiisana Rift Thruster
outfits.description: While the Korath favor raw power in their engines, the Bunrodea favor efficiency, opting to make use of engines that produce less thrust for significantly less heat produced.

outfits.name: Nami Rift Thruster
outfits.description: Although rift engines are extremely heat efficient, their energy requirement is rather high compared to the thrust they produce, even next to terribly inefficient Korath engines.

outfits.name: Ookii Rift Thruster
outfits.description: Even though the energy drawn per unit thrust of rift engines is poorer than that of Korath engines, the overall energy requirement of rift engines is still far lesser by comparison.

outfits.name: Subarashii Rift Thruster
outfits.description: Given the lower size and thrust of rift engines, Bunrodean ships aren't well known for their pursuit capabilities. But there are rumors among some Bunrodea of an ancient cache of engines, more powerful than even those of the Korath, that would allow any ship to zip across the stars like a comet and chase down any potential target.

outfits.name: Chiisana Rift Steering
outfits.description: Given that Bunrodean ships are typically focused on making heavy use of their forward facing guns, the Bunrodea favor high turn rates much more than high speeds. As such, rift steering systems are larger than the respective thruster systems of the same size category.

outfits.name: Nami Rift Steering
outfits.description: As with many Bunrodean systems, rift engines produce very little heat. This allows their ships to forgo the use of any significant cooling systems, leaving more room for other systems, be they defensive or offensive.

outfits.name: Ookii Rift Steering
outfits.description: Although the focus on steering over thrust makes Bunrodean ships easy targets to track, the power of their weapons systems would leave anyone foolish to believe that they are sitting ducks.

outfits.name: Subarashii Rift Steering
outfits.description: The largest of the rift steering systems, these engines are what allow the Bunrodea's heavy gunships to bear their many guns toward their unfortunate target.

outfits.name: Locust Blaster
outfits.description: The Locust Blaster might look small, but its destructive potential for its size is nothing to scoff at. A single blaster is capable of sustaining 1,200 rounds per minute. While each individual projectile from the blaster deals rather insignificant damage, the sheer deluge of projectiles can rip even the largest of ships to shreds in due time.

outfits.name: Locust Turret
outfits.description: Although Bunrodean ships typically rely on the power of their forward facing guns and fill any turret mounts with anti-missile systems, they have developed a turret mount for the Locust Blaster. This turret carries three Locust Blasters that all fire at once, resulting in an astonishing 3,600 projectiles per minute being thrown at the target.

outfits.name: Mandible Cannon
outfits.description: The Mandible Cannon is a significant part of the Bunrodean arsenal due to its versatility. Its range exceeds that of smaller weapons, and its size allows it to be used in numbers on most Bunrodean ships. However, the energy draw required to fire is rather significant, particularly for Bunrodean ships that rely on solar cells.

outfits.name: Thorax Cannon
outfits.description: The Thorax Cannon is a massive, slow-firing weapon that few ships can even support, not only because of its size but also because of the energy needed to fire it. It comes with its own energy capacitors to help alleviate the steep energy cost.

outfits.name: Swarm Clip
outfits.description: Swarm Clips provide a sizable increase in ammo capacity for Swarm Pods, holding a respectable 200 missiles able to be swiftly loaded into a launcher after its current clip is empty.

outfits.name: Swarm Missile
outfits.description: Swarm missiles are small, fast moving munitions for the Swarm Pod.

outfits.name: Swarm Pod
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Buzzer Anti-Missile
outfits.description: As the Korath began to saturate systems with mines, the effectiveness of Bunrodean fighters dropped substantially. In response, the Bunrodea developed this rapid-fire anti-missile turret, able to clear sections of a system of Korath mines at blinding speed.

outfits.name: Beyond the Hyperdrive
outfits.`The: moment you land, Anna arrives, very happy to see you. She grabs your shoulders with both arms and in an excited tone explains that her book has been approved for publication.`
outfits.`: Anna looks disappointed, but the emotion quickly disappears in her flood of exuberence. She dashes off in the direction she came in.`
outfits.label: decline
outfits.My book succeeded beyond my wildest drea: she says, almost in a teary voice. She pulls out a credit chip. "Here, <payment>. You've done so much for me and my career, and you deserve it."`
she explains. "They really went into depth on some aspects of the Coalition's languages. None of the major plot points were changed, thankfully, though some content in the book had to be edited or removed. My Heliarch friend said that if I changed this or removed that, the book would sell so much better, and as they said, they wanted to 'make it more suitable for the Coalition.' Their words.`

outfits.name: Small Collector Module
outfits.description: Solar power is the mainstay of the Coalition's merchant marine. The design of these panels has been refined over the millennia, growing ever more efficient.

outfits.name: Large Collector Module
outfits.description: One of these solar panels is enough to meet the energy needs of a medium-sized Coalition civilian ship, especially given the energy efficiency of their engines and the fact that under their laws only Heliarch ships are allowed to have weapons.

outfits.name: Small Reactor Module
outfits.description: A beam of antiprotons triggers fusion in tiny injected fuel pellets, allowing for a complete burnup far more efficient than would otherwise be possible.

outfits.name: Large Reactor Module
outfits.description: This advanced fusion reactor was designed for the most powerful Heliarch warships. Its structure has not changed significantly in the millennia since the first battle with the Quarg, but each generation of reactors is made slightly more efficient than the previous ones.

outfits.name: Small Cogeneration Module
outfits.description: This compact design recovers much of what would otherwise be waste heat, making it a very efficient fuel cell.

outfits.name: Large Cogeneration Module
outfits.description: Without much exciting work available in peacetime, many Coalition engineers take to tinkering with existing equipment to improve its efficiency.

outfits.name: Small Battery Module
outfits.description: Because Coalition ships rely on solar power, they must also be able to store a substantial amount of energy. This small battery pack is much more efficient than comparable human technology.

outfits.name: Large Battery Module
outfits.description: This battery pack stores enough power to allow a Coalition ship to continue maneuvering even when its solar panels are only producing a fraction of their peak output.

outfits.name: Small Shield Module
outfits.description: Although combat is almost unheard of in Coalition space, almost all of their ships are able to recharge their shields when necessary.

outfits.name: Large Shield Module
outfits.description: The Coalition manufactures heavy shield generators for their ships in case they ever face aggression from the Quarg or another species.

outfits.name: Overcharged Shield Module
outfits.description: These modular shield generators are the most powerful emitters produced in Coalition space, and as such they are strictly controlled and exclusively used by the Heliarchs. The additions made to the Large Shield Module more than tripled its shield generation, but at the cost of it requiring a constant supply of energy to stabilize it.

outfits.name: Small Repair Module
outfits.description: Arach ships, which rely more on strong hull than on energy shields, often carry one of these repair modules to allow damaged hull plating to be patched back together on the fly.

outfits.name: Large Repair Module
outfits.description: This hub houses a small fleet of repair robots that can climb around on a ship's hull and repair damage to it, even in the middle of combat.

outfits.name: Overclocked Repair Module
outfits.description: These advanced repair modules are issued to Heliarch ships, providing hull repair unparalleled in all of Coalition space. The legions of small repair drones come with the extensive pathways they use to quickly get around a ship, and as such the outfit can interfere with a ship's cooling and heat dissipation systems.

outfits.name: Cooling Module
outfits.description: This Cooling Module consumes energy. To conserve power, it does not ramp up to full strength unless a ship is very close to overheating.

outfits.name: Fuel Module
outfits.description: Nowadays, nearly every system in the Coalition has refueling facilities, but some captains still find use in the extra jumps these modules offer.

outfits.name: Decoy Plating
outfits.description: Out of a need to protect themselves against destructive Heliarch torpedoes, the Lunarium incorporated small, independent radar jamming systems in each section of the plating, if only to act as a last line of defense.

outfits.name: Refueling Module
outfits.description: The outfit's mechanisms need a partitioned amount of fuel set aside to allow it to work properly, so a ship can only install so many of these before becoming incapable of jumping to another system.

outfits.name: Shield Refactor Module
outfits.description: A much needed boon against the Heliarch torpedoes' devastating effects on hull plating, the Lunarium highly favors production of this expensive piece due to its advantages over other shield generators.

outfits.name: Small Recovery Module
outfits.description: By combining the Coalition's shield generation and hull repair technologies into one piece of equipment, the Lunarium has increased the effectiveness of both, allowing for better defenses against Heliarch weaponry.

outfits.name: Scanning Module
outfits.description: This system allows the Heliarchs to scan nearby ships, enabling them to detect weapons or illegal goods.

outfits.name: Outskirts Gauger
outfits.description: Constantly running its calculations about every little thing it detects within its impressive range, the gauger needs a steady supply of energy to function.

outfits.name: Small Thrust Module
outfits.description: This tiny thruster produces a considerable amount of thrust... but also a considerable amount of heat.

outfits.name: Large Thrust Module
outfits.description: Coalition engineers prefer to focus on perfecting a few versatile designs rather than producing a wide range of them. This thruster is quite efficient, but large ships will need several of them stacked together to produce sufficient thrust.

outfits.name: Small Reverse Module
outfits.description: Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.

outfits.name: Large Reverse Module
outfits.description: Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.

outfits.name: Small Steering Module
outfits.description: Despite its high efficiency, this module is not sufficient for any but the tiniest of ships. Instead, the modules are designed with the expectation that ships may use two or three of them in tandem.

outfits.name: Large Steering Module
outfits.description: By focusing on small, modular engines rather than the massive capital ship drives that most other species develop, the Coalition loses some of the potential efficiency for very large ships, but gains a considerable amount of flexibility.

outfits.name: Enforcer Confrontation Gear
outfits.description: The peak of Heliarch combat engineering, this weapon uses condensed blasts of energy to dispatch any who dare threaten the safety of the Coalition.

outfits.name: Enforcer Riot Staff
outfits.description: Made to deal with the occasional dissidents that pop up around Coalition space in a non-lethal manner, these weapons see minimal use in shipbound combat, but are carried anyway in the event a dissident gets aboard.

outfits.name: Guardian Turret
outfits.description: The only downside is the relatively tedious process of registering every member of the crew with the turrets' systems, so that it can recognize and avoid firing at allies during boarding encounters.

outfits.name: Anti-Materiel Gun
outfits.description: Easy to use and relatively cheap to manufacture, these weapons were born by refurbishing the Heliarchs' favored arms, with the new barrel shaping the energy into deadly blasts that make short work of even the toughest body armor.

outfits.name: Coalition License
outfits.description: There is a history of controversy surrounding this license, as throughout the millennia several Heliarch laws have been in a back and forth regarding the conditions that need to be met for someone to obtain a license. This argument started with the third Civil Goods and Fares Act, created just a few decades after the War of Independence. It has continued all the way to the relatively recent twenty-sixth addendum to the second article of the Ninth Rectification on Commerce and Traffic, passed two hundred years ago, which made the acquisition requirements much more flexible.

outfits.name: Heliarch License
outfits.description: An ornate circlet of gold and platinum, it serves as both a symbol of rank and as a license to access exclusive Heliarch facilities. Custom-made to fit a human's head, it's surprisingly light and comfortable.

outfits.name: Beyond the Hyperdrive
outfits.description: The story follows a human captain who steals a jump drive from the Quarg and travels beyond the hyperlanes, learning new things about the aliens of the galaxy.

outfits.name: Bombardment Cannon
outfits.description: The Bombardment Cannon was designed during the original war with the Quarg, in order to give Heliarch civilian ships a way to strike Quarg warships from a safe distance. But now, as with all their weapons, its use is limited to Heliarch warships.

outfits.name: Bombardment Turret
outfits.description: A Bombardment Turret is not one of the most dangerous Heliarch weapons, but it has the advantage that it can hit targets a considerable distance away.

outfits.name: Finisher Pod
outfits.description: Finisher Torpedoes are one of the Heliarchs' most dreaded weapons. In fact, in one way or another most of their other weapons merely exist to hold a ship in place for long enough for a barrage of Finishers to destroy it.

outfits.name: Finisher Maegrolain
outfits.furious thunderstorm,: this enormous launcher is not meant for prolonged fights nor for use by lighter craft, but for delivering a few quick, devastating bursts of Finisher Torpedoes. It has much greater damage potential than its smaller counterpart.`
outfits.description: Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

outfits.name: Finisher Storage Tube
outfits.description: In order to allow Heliarch ships to install more Finisher Storage Tubes, Heliarch engineers have incorporated a tiny battery pack into each module. This allows for Heliarch ships to have a respectable energy capacity while also carrying a fearsome number of Finishers.

outfits.name: Finisher Torpedo
outfits.description: A substantial fraction of the Heliarch military complex is devoted to supervising the refining, enrichment, and breeding of nuclear fuels. Having ensured a steady supply of feedstock, they are able to produce a selective set of highly exotic fissile materials. With minuscule critical masses and favorable neutronics properties, these carefully controlled isotopes are the key to giving the miniaturized nuclear warhead in the Finisher Torpedo enough power to deter any would-be threats to the Coalition. 	This extremely powerful but also expensive missile is ammunition for the Heliarch Finisher Pod.

outfits.name: Heliarch Attractor
outfits.description: When battling the Quarg, the Heliarchs learned that the Quarg would not engage in a battle that their ships might be unable to escape. In response, they focused on building weapons that would keep a ship from being able to come to a stop and activate its jump drive.

outfits.name: Heliarch Repulsor
outfits.description: This beam turret allows a Heliarch ship to hold its enemies far enough away that they cannot make use of their short-range weapons.

outfits.name: Ion Hail Turret
outfits.description: Instead of just placing an Ion Rain Gun on a turret mount, the Heliarch tweaked the cycles of shots, having each shot be significantly more effective and seeing an overall increase to the weapon's range, but at the cost of a reload period.

outfits.name: Ion Rain Gun
outfits.description: Heliarch ships primarily serve as a police force. This weapon is designed to neutralize a target's offensive capabilities until more Heliarch ships can join the fray.

outfits.name: MCS Extractor
outfits.Mineral Collection and Sorting: extraction unit consists of a set of sharp, durable blades designed to quickly break down minable asteroids. It also comes with an integrated scanning system that looks for asteroids rich in minerals to facilitate the mining efforts.`
outfits.description: Especially popular with novice pilots looking to pay off their ships, the extractor has been a reliable tool of mining businesses in the Coalition for millennia.

outfits.name: Drak Distancer
outfits.description: This is a thruster that can produce force in any direction, allowing a Drak ship to keep a safe distance away from its target.

outfits.name: Drak Draining Field
outfits.description: This device is the Archon's primary defensive tool: not only does it disrupt the shields and energy supplies of all hostile ships within it, it also exerts a powerful repelling force that keeps ships from closing in with the Archon.

outfits.name: Drak Draining Field (Augmented)
outfits.description: While normally kept at minimal strength, the Archons have demonstrated the ability to ramp up the field to be vastly stronger when faced with a serious threat.

outfits.name: Drak Anti-Missile Field
outfits.description: This device produces a field that destroys any missiles that come within it.

outfits.name: Drak Anti-Missile Field (Augmented)
outfits.description: This level of anti-missile effectiveness is required only when dealing with the most powerful of threats.

outfits.name: Drak Turret
outfits.description: This is a turret-based cannon with significant range and accuracy.

outfits.name: Drak Turret (Augmented)
outfits.description: Against most threats, Archons respond with their weapons set to very low levels. They are, however, more than capable of dealing much more damage when the situation requires it.

outfits.name: Drak Antimatter Cannon
outfits.description: This is the most powerful weapon that the Archons deign to utilize in the presence of the younger races.

outfits.name: Drak Antimatter Cannon (Augmented)
outfits.description: This is the most powerful weapon that the Archons deign to utilize in the presence of the younger races. Hitherto unknown as Archons are rarely pushed to the point of needing to use more than their minimum abilities, the Antimatter Cannon is capable of far more damage than originally thought.

outfits.name: R01 Skirmish Battery
outfits.description: Skirmish Batteries are very common outfits on Gegno ships. They can be either a cheaper alternative than upgrading to a larger reactor, or a nice addition alongside one where short bursts of high energy may be needed.

outfits.name: R02 Battlezone Battery
outfits.description: Battlezone Batteries are primarily used on the Gegno's medium-range combat vessels, holding a moderate amount of power for long-lasting engagements. They also fit nicely on larger vessels as a buffer to power their more energy-hungry systems.

outfits.name: R03 Warforge Battery
outfits.description: Warforge Batteries have proven their usefulness over the years as large, sturdy battery packs. They support the equally large volleys that are fired from Gegno ships, and help maintain an excess of power for engine usage.

outfits.name: R04 Crusade Battery
outfits.description: As the largest battery mounted on power-hungry Gegno ships, the Crusade Battery holds an immense amount of energy, more than a Scrap Cell could produce in almost two minutes. However, the Gegno are inefficient at increasing density with size. As a result, these batteries are generally only used on ships that consistently need this sort of power reserve, while most other ships simply stack multiple smaller batteries that are more convenient to install or remove according to their needs.

outfits.name: C3 Scrap Cell
outfits.description: The Scrap Cell is a small radiothermal generator that produces a limited amount of energy. It is only used on the Gegno's smaller-sized vessels, or in tandem with their less energy-hungry internals.

outfits.name: C7 Brawl Cell
outfits.description: When developing the C7 Brawl Cell, the Gegno decided to scale up the smaller C3 Scrap Cell. Unfortunately, the new design became so tall that the Gegno struggled to fit it into some of their ships, requiring them to turn the entire thing sideways. This design still serves the Gegno well, though it will likely be phased out in favor of newer generators as they become more compact and efficient.

outfits.name: C17 Warzone Core
outfits.description: The Gegno began developing nuclear technology once their cities grew massive enough to require it. The Warzone Core is a medium-sized nuclear fission reactor that is a suitable power source for most of the Gegno's large ships, though it appears to lack many of the fail-safes you would expect to find on a human nuclear reactor.

outfits.name: C27 Campaign Core
outfits.description: In order to power the largest of vessels along with their energy-guzzling systems and engines, the Gegno designed the Campaign fusion reactor from earlier prototypes dating back to their generation ship era. It's still used to this day and is efficient enough to satisfy the requirements of the largest of Gegno warships, but just looking at it raises safety concerns.

outfits.name: I70 Ameliorate Cell
outfits.description: The I70 Cell was designed by the Scin as a smaller, more compact power system for their Halite fighters. It has enough energy generation and capacity to fuel the Halite's thrusters and their weapons for a short period. Unfortunately, as a side effect, a bit more excess heat is also generated.

outfits.name: RG15 Torch Thruster
outfits.description: The RG15 Ion Torch Thruster is the Gegno Vi's smallest torch thruster, found almost exclusively on the Slate. It is somewhat inefficient, weighing more and producing more heat than most thrusters of a similar size in exchange for using slightly less energy.

outfits.name: RG15 Torch Steering
outfits.description: This steering system is meant for the smallest of Gegno Vi ships. However, some Gegno pilots use it to cheaply supplement their main steering engines.

outfits.name: RG18 Torch Thruster
outfits.description: The RG18 is a moderately large thruster used by the Gegno Vi. Ion Torch Thrusters are similar to human ion thrusters, but their explosive exhaust causes them to run hotter. However, they also require slightly less energy.

outfits.name: RG18 Torch Steering
outfits.description: The RG18 Steering system is quite large for a steering system of its power. Many Gegno Vi ships install these as a minimum to be able to turn their already heavy ships.

outfits.name: RG3 Torch Thruster
